items.q: When animals live in their natural habitat, they live naturally by ____. a. extinct b. confinement c. instinct d. conservation
When an animal's habitat has been destroyed, they can become endangered, or ____. a. conserved b. dignified c. extinct d. instinct
People opposed to keeping animals in zoos say this unnatural environment makes animals lose their ____. a. gender b. sleep c. dignity d. confinement
The London Zoological Society ____ in 1826. a. was found b. had found c. was founded d. was lost
Many zoo animals lose their natural behaviors because they cannot ____ to the zoo environment. a. adapts b. adapt c. adaptation d. adapted
The San Diego Zoo works to maintain the lives of endangered animals through ____ and breeding programs. a. conserved b. conservation c. conserves d. conserve

An argument essay ____. a. gives reasons why you support or don't support an issue b. uses only facts and not opinions c. uses only opinions and not facts d. does not support one side of an issue or the other side
Which transition words begin supporting paragraphs in an argument essay? a. the first reason, the second reason b. the first example, the second example c. before, after d. in summary, in conclusion
The U.S. grows ____ of the world's genetically modified crops. a. 10 % b. 25 % c. 100 % d. 75 %
The number of people that die from hunger-related causes ____ 40,000 people each day. a. is limited to b. is approximately c. decreases by d. cannot be counted at

Which example is not a benefit of genetically modified crops? a. they taste better than crops not genetically modified b. they can be more nutritional c. they reduce the use of herbicides d. they can be pest resistant
Today there is scientific work being done to manufacture a genetically modified potato that would not ____ much fat. a. absorbs b. absorbent c. absorb d. absorbing

Which supporting sentence is not relevant in an essay opposed to the use of zoos? a. The San Diego Zoo was founded in 50 years ago. b. Zoo animals often get zoochosis. c. Zoo animals unnaturally pace up and down. d. Zoo animals often have breeding problems.

Which supporting sentence has concrete support? a. Genetically modified foods are dangerous. b. A 1994 lab experiment showed that genetically modified corn could harm the genes of humans. c. Genetically modified crops have been grown for a few years. d. The U.S. grows many different genetically modified crops.

If a genetically modified crop is grown to resist herbicides, a farmer can spray herbicides on a field and ____. a. the crop will die b. not harm the crop c. the crop will become poisonous d. increase the crop's nutritional value
The desire to stay young can be see in ____. a. an increase in obesity b. an increase in cosmetic surgery c. an increase in disease d. an increase in traveling

When gene scientists modify one gene in fruit flies and rodents, they are able to ____. a. decrease their lifespan b. increase their lifespan c. create a successful breeding environment d. modify their habitat
Riding a bicycle when there’s snow on the ground is _____. a. risk b. risky c. riskiness d. risks
Television is my favorite form of _____. a. entertaining b. entertain c. entertainment d. entertained
If an animal is confined, it is _____. a. endangered b. in a cage c. in the wild d. sick
A database contains _____. a. food b. animals c. information d. money
If an animal adapts, it _____. a. changes b. becomes extinct c. entertains people d. dies
_____ are chemicals that are used to protect crops. a. Insect b. Insects c. Insecticide d. Insecticides
The _____ value of food depends on how fresh it is. a. nutritional b. nutrition c. nutritious d. nutrient
Spraying plants with pesticides _____ bigger crops. a. produce b. product c. production d. produces
Which phrase best describes a weed ? a. a useless plant b. a GM plant c. a type of vegetable d. a type of crop
Which word describes a chemical that kills plants? a. modified b. substance c. herbicide d. resistance
If a food is good for you, it has _____ value. a. nutritional b. resistant c. pesticide d. drought
Some insects are _____. a. genes b. cells c. pests d. fertilizers
If a plant is resistant to a disease, the plant _____. a. is destroyed by it b. is genetically modified by it c. is not badly affected by it d. receives nutritional value from it
Corn and wheat are examples of _____. a. crops b. soils c. bacteria d. risks
By 2025, the world’s population may _____ 8 billion. a. absorb b. modify c. increase d. exceed
If a substance is scarce, _____. a. there is poison in it b. it is highly nutritional c. there is not much of it d. it is a chemical
Today there is an international species database where zoos can register the endangered species at their zoo.
One way to continue to protect endangered species is to destroy their habitat.
Henry Salt's book, Animal Rights , supports the position of keeping animals in zoos.
Abnormal animal behavior while living in cages in a zoo is called zoochosis.
An argument essay is also referred to as a persuasion essay.
If an essay contains relevant supporting ideas, it means that the supporting ideas are directly connected to the topic.
When you use concrete support, you support your opinions with general statements.
In an argument essay, it's OK to use phrases for support such as, "People say ," or " Authorities agree."
In an argument essay, be sure you follow the same organization plan as for a comparison or contrast essay.
Vitamin C has been added to the genetically modified rice called golden rice .
The sentence Many people eat genetically modified food contains a concrete supporting detail.
The abbreviation e.g. means for example.
A relative whom you mention by name is a reliable source of authority in an argument essay.
Write the thesis statement.
Is the writer for or against genetically modifying human lifespans?
Write one sentence that supports the thesis statement.
Write an essay outline for an argument essay that supports the use of humans rather than lab animals for disease studies.
